title: Uncontrollable computer problems.
body:
Lately i have been experiencing major overheating problems. There is nothing i can do at this moment but i plan to fix it, I have purchased a a new cooler that "should" be cooling it a major amount but in fact isn't. Sometimes It overheats in league games and won't start for a while and sometimes i can be playing Call of duty: Advanced warfare and it would be below 60, but over 70 for league. Sometimes the other way around.

Specs:
CPU: Radeon Fx 8350
GPU: Amd R9 280x
Ram: Corsair 16GB 1600 mhz
Motherboard: Asrock Fatal1ty 990FX Killer

Expectation:    {{summoner:6}} 
Reality:      {{summoner:3}} 

Any game leaves in the future for the next month or so will not be intentional it is merely a mishap that i cannot control.

replies.body:
Are you sure it's actually over heating? Do you have a power supply that can actually supply enough power to the components?

If it is over heating what I would check is that you have sufficient air flow on the case and that the fans are facing the correct directions (It should say in the instruction booklet that comes with the case)
It's only a rare occurrence league will over heat it anyway maybe like once a month if that, so i should be fine just wanted to tell people about it
did you apply the thermal paste correctly by applying a small pea shape glob in the middle.
I'm not going to skip playing league for a month.

If you're going to intentionally play an online game and potentially ruin the match for 9 other people multiple times because of a problem you know exists then you deserve whatever punishment Riot/leaverbuster gives you.

http://www.pccasegear.com/index.php?main_page=product_info&cPath=207_23&products_id=29010

Pretty sure my cpu is fried.

What cooling do you have setup?
Stock cooler on the CPU? If so, I'd suggest changing that. The stock AMD coolers are absolute rubbish.

Is your CPU or GPU overheating.. because league shouldn't be causing that either way.
Definitely need to look into a better cooling solution.

Also saying that any leaves in the next month or unintentional doesn't matter. You'll still end up getting a leaverbuster ban if it happens enough.

Topkek; is your CPU overheating or your GPU? Check the CPU fan and/or apply thermal paste.

I've been playing League on an 11" notebook for a year and a half. No way that can struggle with League.

Are you using the right temp monitor like CPUID HWMonitor, Have you check your cable management like it not blocking any possible airflow airflow passages to the fans. Is your computer clean as in not extremely dusty if it is use a compressed air from a can or a compressor would do even if it is a bit dusty just clean it anyways.. Just use short bursts at a time. If still having unsatisfactory temps take off the side panel and stick a fan blowing air into it which should decrease temps a fair bit. Dear god you should not be even hitting those temps especially League of Legends the recommended temp of an FX processor should be 62 Celsius. I have a AMD FX6300 @ 4.6 Ghz and during League it never got above 45 depending on the day. By the way I have a Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO fantastic cooler.
You can control whether you play or not.....
